value.title: How to deploy your web app using GitHub Actions | Azure Portal Series
value.excerpt: In this video of the Azure Portal “How To” Series, learn how to deploy Azure web apps using GitHub Actions.   Try out these features in the Azure portal: https://portal.azure.com    Keep connected on Twitter: https://twitter.com/AzurePortal    And make sure to keep an eye on our Azure Portal "How to"

value.title: How to export your resources to CSV using the Azure Portal | Azure Portal Series
value.excerpt: The Azure Portal allows you to customize the information you'd like to export. In this video of the Azure Portal "How To" Series, learn how to easily export your files to CSV.   Try out these features in the Azure portal: https://portal.azure.com     Keep connected on Twitter: https://twitter.com/AzurePortal

value.title: How to troubleshoot the most common issues on Azure resources | Azure Portal Series
value.excerpt: In this video of the Azure Portal “How To” Series, you will learn how to troubleshoot the most common issues on Azure resources using the new Diagnose and Solve Problems feature.   Try out these features in the Azure portal: https://portal.azure.com     Keep connected on Twitter: https://twitter.com/AzurePortal

value.title: How to use Azure Automation with PowerShell | Azure Tips and Tricks
value.excerpt: In this edition of Azure Tips and Tricks, learn how to use Azure Automation with a Windows Machine with PowerShell. Azure Automation makes it easy to do common tasks like, scaling Azure SQL Database up and down and starting and stopping a virtual machine.   For more tips and tricks, visit: http://azuredev.tips
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/pQ9dQ13B2vM" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: How to use Jupyter Notebooks in Azure Data Studio | Azure Friday
value.excerpt: Vicky Harp joins Scott Hanselman to show how Azure Data Studio combined the simple and robust SQL query editing experience of tools like SSMS with the flexibility and collaboration of Jupyter Notebooks. The November 2019 release of Azure Data Studio included SQL Server 2019 Guide as a Jupyter Book, which
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/pHuRj9ty9cI" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: Learn all about Distributed Application Runtime (Dapr), Part 1 | Azure Friday
value.excerpt: Aman Bhardwaj and Yaron Schneider join Scott Hanselman to talk about the core concepts of Distributed Application Runtime (Dapr). Dapr is a portable, event-driven runtime that makes it easy for developers to build resilient, microservice stateless and stateful applications that run on the cloud and edge

value.title: Protect your web applications using WAF with Azure Front Door | Azure Friday
value.excerpt: Sharad Agrawal and Teresa Yao join Scott Hanselman to introduce Web Application Firewall (WAF) with Azure Front Door. They show how to configure and block malicious attacks against web applications at the edge of Microsoft's network. WAF with Azure Front Door is the best solution to help protect your

value.title: What are work or school, and Microsoft personal accounts? | One Dev Question: Jean-Marc Prieur
value.excerpt: In the One Dev Question series, Jean-Marc Prieur, a Principal Program Manager Program Manager working on the Microsoft identity platform, explains the difference between work and school accounts, and personal Microsoft accounts.   Get more information at: https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/active-directory/develop/
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/E2OUluQQKSk" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: Introduction to version control with Git
value.excerpt: Git is the leading version control tool and essential for developers. Learn how to leverage Git to track your own changes and collaborate with others.

topItems.title: Introduction to Git
topItems.excerpt: Use Git to track changes and collaborate with other developers

topItems.title: Collaborate with Git
topItems.excerpt: Use Git to track changes to source code and collaborate with other developers

topItems.title: Edit code through branching and merging in Git
topItems.excerpt: Level up your Git knowledge by learning about how to keep code separate using branches and how to merge them later

value.title: Process and Translate Speech with Azure Cognitive Speech Services
value.excerpt: Learn how to implement the Speech services found in Azure Cognitive Services by performing speech-to-text transcription, synthesize text input to speech, perform speech translation, and implement speaker recognition in your AI infused applications

topItems.title: Transcribe speech input to text
topItems.excerpt: Speech to text from the speech service, known as speech recognition, enables real time transcription of audio streams into text. Your applications, tools, or devices can consume, display, and take action on this text as command input.

topItems.title: Synthesize Text Input to Speech
topItems.excerpt: Learn how to synthesize text to speech using the Speech-to-Text service.

topItems.title: Translate speech with the speech service
topItems.excerpt: Perform speech translation tasks with the speech service to translate spoken text to different languages.

value.title: Analyze text with the Text Analytics service
value.excerpt: The Text Analytics service is a cloud-based service that provides advanced natural language processing over raw text for sentiment analysis, key phrase extraction, named entity recognition, and language detection.

value.title: Introduction to blockchain on Azure
value.excerpt: Introduction to blockchain on Azure. See how blockchain allows business partners to trust each other's data without a central authority. You'll also learn a bit about how blockchain works. The goal is to help you decide if blockchain is a good choice for your scenario.

value.title: Putting it all together with Azure SQL
value.excerpt: Putting it all together with Azure SQL

value.title: Introduction to the Microsoft Azure Well-Architected Framework
value.excerpt: Learn how using key principles throughout your cloud architecture can help you design and build a solid architectural foundation that you can continuously improve.

value.title: Microsoft Azure Well-Architected Framework - Operational excellence
value.excerpt: Learn how to design an Azure architecture that uses modern practices and gives you full visibility into what's happening in your environment.

value.title: Microsoft Azure Well-Architected Framework - Reliability
value.excerpt: Learn how to recover from infrastructure and service failure, loss of data, and disasters by incorporating reliability into your architecture.

value.title: Back up and restore your Azure SQL database
value.excerpt: Protect the data in your Azure SQL database and recover from data loss or corruption with backup and restore.

value.title: Learn how to use Solidity
value.excerpt: Discover how Solidity can help you program smart contracts for the Ethereum blockchain platform.

value.title: Edit code through branching and merging in Git
value.excerpt: Level up your Git knowledge by learning about how to keep code separate using branches and how to merge them later

value.title: Build a web API with Node.js and Express
value.excerpt: Use Express for Node.js to build RESTful APIs. Create and configure middleware to add things like logging and authentication/authorization. Use JavaScript/TypeScript with Express to create a Node.js web server with Visual Studio Code.

value.title: Build a web app with Blazor WebAssembly and Visual Studio Code
value.excerpt: Learn how to set up your development environment and build your first WebAssembly app with Blazor, Visual Studio Code, and C#.

value.title: Chain Azure Functions together using input and output bindings
value.excerpt: In this module, we'll learn how to integrate your Azure Function with various data sources by using bindings.

value.title: Classify and moderate text with Azure Content Moderator
value.excerpt: In this module, we'll introduce you to Azure Content Moderator and show how to use it for text moderation

value.title: Collaborate with Git
value.excerpt: Use Git to track changes to source code and collaborate with other developers

value.title: Communicate between applications with Azure Queue storage
value.excerpt: Find out to use Azure Queue storage to handle high demand and improve resilience in your distributed applications.

value.title: Build a .NET Core app for Azure Cosmos DB in Visual Studio Code
value.excerpt: Learn how to create a .NET Core application to store and query data in Azure Cosmos DB by using Visual Studio Code.

value.title: Design a geographically distributed application
value.excerpt: Build an application that spans multiple geographic locations for high availability and resiliency.

value.title: Design a data warehouse with Azure Synapse Analytics
value.excerpt: Learn how to create a data warehouse in Azure Synapse Analytics in minutes to take advantage of massively parallel processing (MPP) and run complex queries at petabyte scale quickly

value.title: Develop, test, and publish Azure Functions by using Azure Functions Core Tools
value.excerpt: Find out how to develop an Azure Function in Visual Studio with a test framework to create, deploy, and test this scalable and secure service.

value.title: Develop, test, and deploy an Azure Function with Visual Studio
value.excerpt: Use Visual Studio together with a test framework to create, deploy, and test an Azure Function.
